derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English wrencan 'twist', of unknown origin

entry.def: If you wrench something that is fixed in a particular position, you pull or twist it violently, in order to move or remove it.

example.ex: He felt two men wrench the suitcase from his hand...
example.tran: 他感觉有两个人在使劲拽他手里的手提箱。

entry.def: If you wrench yourself free from someone who is holding you, you get away from them by suddenly twisting the part of your body that is being held.

example.ex: She wrenched herself from his grasp...

entry.def: If you wrench one of your joints, you twist it and injure it.

example.ex: He had wrenched his ankle badly from the force of the fall.
example.tran: 他因摔倒而严重扭伤了脚踝。

entry.def: If you say that leaving someone or something is a wrench, you feel very sad about it.

example.ex: I always knew it would be a wrench to leave Essex after all these years...
example.tran: 我一直心里清楚过了这么多年后离开埃塞克斯会非常痛苦。

example.ex: Many of the things are of great sentimental value and it is going to be a wrench parting with them...
example.tran: 其中很多东西都具有重要的情感价值，令人难以割舍。

entry.def: A wrench or a monkey wrench is an adjustable metal tool used for tightening or loosening metal nuts of different sizes.
If someone throws a wrench or throws a monkey wrench into a process, they prevent something happening smoothly by deliberately causing a problem.

example.ex: Their delegation threw a giant monkey wrench into the process this week by raising all sorts of petty objections.
example.tran: 他们的代表团本周提出了各种细枝末节的反对意见，极在地阻挠了进程。

means.word_mean: 1. a sharp strain on muscles or ligaments;

sentences.sentence: "the wrench to his knee occurred as he fell"
"he was sidelined with a hamstring pull"

means.word_mean: 3. a hand tool that is used to hold or twist a nut or bolt
1. twist or pull violently or suddenly, especially so as to remove (something) from that to which it is attached or from where it originates;

sentences.sentence: "a deep sigh was wrenched from his chest"

means.word_mean: 3. twist and compress, as if in pain or anguish;
4. twist suddenly so as to sprain;

sentences.sentence: "the hikers sprained their ankles when they fell"
"I turned my ankle and couldn't walk for several days"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Gi Hop is a wrench into something more upbeat.

auth_sentence.content: He gave a convulsive wrench of his whole body.

auth_sentence.content: It will be a terrible wrench leaving Parliament.

sentences.en: He wrenched the book from her hands.
sentences.cn: 他从她的手中把书拧抢了过来。

means.word_mean: 一拧; 一扳; 猛扭, 猛拉

sentences.en: He pulled the handle off with a wrench.
sentences.cn: 他一拧就把把手拧了下来。

jushi.english: All of a sudden her heart wrenched.
In the accident she wrenched her neck.
jushi.chinese: 在那次事故中她把脖子扭伤了。

jushi.english: He wrenched the meaning of the word.
jushi.chinese: 他曲解了这个词的含义。
